fields.description:
I'm trying to import a csv file into JIRA. I do this:
1. ) I select Issues --> Import issues from CSV
2.) I configure a) Settings, b) Map fields (I tick "Map Field Value" for some CSV fields), c) Map values
3.) I click on "Validate"
4.) I click on "Save the configuration file"

After some fixes I start the import again, using the saved configuration file. This works fine apart from the fact that the information regarding which CSV fields that had the column "Map Field Value" ticked is lost.
fields.summary: Map field value not saved in BulkCreate-configuration file

fields.description:
I created new user in Jira.
Immeadiately before this user even could log in I noticed that I made a small typo in his username so I changed his username.

Now whenever this user or anyone else checks any Issues History view where he had made any changes, they will see his old and typoed username instead of the corrected one.

Everywhere else in Jira the new username is shown, but not in History page.
fields.summary: Wrong username shown in Issue History page if username is changed

fields.description:
h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create issues in JIRA with a user 'test'
# Set the user 'test' as 'inactive'
# Try to bulk move the recently created issues by 'test' user to another project
# Notice that JIRA forces to change the reporter from 'test' to another active user. This is expected behaviour as per : https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-34148.
# Now try to open one issue in the browser and try to move that one issue to another project.
# Notice that JIRA does not complain about the reporter now and allows to move the issue.


NOTE : This issue is not reproducible in 6.2.7 version of JIRA. So most likely its a bug in the older releases.
fields.summary: Single issue move with inactive user is allowed but not multiple issues move

fields.description:
Edit and Bulk Edit do not support changing the "Creator" field.

On a recent upgrade to JIRA v. 6.3.8 we hit a problem where hundreds of the issues which had a reporter, did not get the name transferred to the creator field, leaving hundreds of issues with the creator listed as "Anonymous Creator".  In attempting to remedy this problem, it turns out the "creator" field can not be altered either through the edit screen or the bulk edit screen.
fields.summary: Edit and Bulk Edit do not support changing the "Creator" field
Active User documentation.
Re-index project should offer user a confirmation prompt
Make sub-task list view user-configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41524].
  {panel}

The ability to create a version 'On the fly' is introduced in [JIRA 6.3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/JIRA+6.3+Release+Notes]. However, only *Project Administrators* can perform this action. If a normal user is creating the issue, they won't be able to create new versions while creating issues. The same goes for Components. This is because only *Project Administrators* can create Versions and Components in the first place.

One of the features which is going to be implemented by JRA-3156 would be for other roles (eg. Project Developers) to create Versions. This would mean that these roles should be able to create versions 'On the Fly' as well.

Since other roles can create versions 'On the Fly' it would be great to have an option to define exactly which roles can perform this and which can't.

For example, if I give Project Developers the ability the create versions, it would be because I (as administrator) am not the one which needs to create them. Therefore I should be able to configure such that only Project Developers can create versions 'On the Fly' while Project Administrators can't since I'm not the one handling them anyway
fields.summary: Define roles which are able to create versions 'On the Fly'
Apply bulk multi-value options to custom fields

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41520].
  {panel}

Hi dear JIRA team!

First of all I would like to describe what I'm doing. I'm extending my extension for the google chrome browser called *jironimo*. Problem I have is that too often JIRA replies with 500 status to a linked ajax query. For example: I'm searching and getting 100 issues and then I'm doing *mypermissions* call for each of them. The purpose is to show the "play" button(time-log feature) icon. (reproducible on different JIRA instances)

What I've tried to google is how to get *mypermissions* data withing the *search* call. Something like this: &expand=mypermissions, which is eq. to: mypermissions?issueId=SearchResultIssueId. But I didn't manage to find it. 

Could you complete one of them:
1. Improve the docs, add this section to the rest API if there is an option.
2. Implement this functionality if possible.

The positive sides for JIRA project:
1. Less calls to the REST API
2. More logical output of a search result entry

Thank you!
fields.summary: Expand permissions during search process
Ability to change the transition button color

Hi

It would be very useful for us to be able to filter on the user who made the last comment. eg. 'last commented by' = joe blogs or 'last commented by' is null (i.e no comments made).
Linked to this would be the request to have a column for 'last commented by' so when viewing a list of issues can see and sort by the user who made the last comment.

Thanks
Laura

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41496].
  {panel}

The new menu bar design has a range of problems and I would really want the old design back. But since we're stuck with the new one, at least for the time being, I'd like to suggest one specific, simple improvement:

Currently, when clicking on any of the menu items (Dashboards, Projects, Issues etc) there's a bit of a lag, and then the menu drops down with a list of options. Only then is one able to get to the desired destination. It drives me absolutely nuts.

Instead, it would be great if a single click on any of those menu items sent me straight to the last page/view I was viewing within that context. If I want the list instead, I either do a mouseover or hit the arrow.

Example #1: A click on "Dashboards" would get me straight to the last dashboard i was viewing.

Example #2: A click on "Issues" would get me straight to the last filter view

Example #2: A click on "Projects" would get me straight to the last project I was viewing.

This tiny fix would make navigating the new menu bar UI so much easier.
fields.summary: Simplify navigation by introducing single-click shortcuts on menu bar items (mitigate recent menu bar usability regression)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41493].
  {panel}

It is the case with all OnDemand instances that some screens can be displayed without loggin in (if someone knows the the instance address).  They don't expose much information, but still, the company logo (if added) is there, as well as the fact that JIRA Agile is active:
- https://<instance>/secure/RapidStart.jspa
- https://<instance>/secure/Dashboard.jspa

Privacy-wise, it would be better if any anonymous user that shouldn't have access to the instance was automatically redirected to the login page upon attempting to open the above screens.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41479].
  {panel}

Hey OnDemand,

I set this as critical because 1. it's an easy fix and 2. it looks extremely bad to a new evaluator. 

When an evaluator logs into their new JIRA OD instance they see the JIRA 101 Guide linked from the System Dashboard. The link take them to apage not found error on https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AOD/JIRA+OnDemand?utm_campaign=qAwr63Ru&utm_medium=navbar&utm_source=inproduct. Even though the correct link is directly below this error it has already caused a bit of confusion with some evaluators.

Thanks!

Marian
fields.summary: JIRA 101 Guide Link Needs Updating
Create documentation about "Archiving a Project" for Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41472].
  {panel}

We are using Jira On Demand and setting up a story template with subtasks so that we can standardize on a story format for our Jira Agile Scrum Boards with defined Subtask.

However, when CLONING the template Story, all of the subtask have the prefix, CLONE added to them. This is not needed and is very annoying to remove manually. Further, if one of these CLONED Stories are CLONED, then the prefix, CLONE - CLONE is created.

We would like to have the setting for no need for the Subtasks to add the word, "CLONED".

This used to be available with an addon called Clone Plus, but I do not see that this addon is available for Jira On Demand.

Please fix Jira On Demand for our site to not add the prefix.
Our site is ntt-innovation.atlassian.net

Thanks
fields.summary: Remove CLONE from Subtasks when Cloning a Story

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41429].
  {panel}

I seem to get this error a lot in a day, at least 3-4 times through normal usage of JIRA OnDemand.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a bug, attach an image
# Do something else for a few minutes while you wait for the upload
# Submit the bug

h4. Expected Results

Bug is always submitted

h4. Actual Results

Several times per day the error message "Temporary attachment not found. Session may have timed out before submitting the form" is shown, even if I was away for only a few minutes, and the attachments need to be re-added.

In these instances, I don't need to re-login or do anything else, simply re-attaching the images works. Which leads me to believe this is not related to session control.
fields.summary: JIRA OnDemand is subject to "Temporary attachment not found. Session may have timed out before submitting the form"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-41428].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce in our instance:
*Create a new user
# Set the user as the default value for the custom field "UserPickerTest" - https://jumpstart.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ConfigureCustomField!default.jspa?customFieldId=10509
# Delete the user you used as the default value
# Attempt to create any type of issue, in any project
# Observe the error message when you select the "Create" button.

*From scratch
# Create new custom field - https://jumpstart.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
# Select "Add Custom Field" button near top right of screen.
# Select "User Picker (single user) on the "Select a Field Type" window, then select the "Next" button near the lower right corner of the window.
# Enter a name for the field in the "Configure 'User Picker (single user)' Field" window.
     - I named the field UserPickerTest and left the description blank
# Select the "Create" button in the lower right corner of the "Configure 'User Picker (single user)' Field" window.
# Do not associate the field with any screens on the "Associate field "UserPickerTest" page and select the "update" button near the bottom of the page.

# Create a new user - https://jumpstart.atlassian.net/admin/users
 # Select "Create user" button near the top of the page
# Uncheck "Email a link to the user to set their password"
# Enter username, name, email address, password, and password confirmation.
# Only have JIRA checked for "Application access"
# Select "Create user" button near the bottom/center of the page.
- I used the following details.
- Username - testuserpickerfield
- Name - Test Userpickerfield
- Email address - Test@Userpickerfield.com

* Set a default value for the custom field "UserPickerTest" -https://jumpstart.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa
 # Select the dropdown arrow on the right side of the page, for the "UserPickerTest" field and select "configure"
# Under the Default Configuration Scheme, select "Edit Default Value"
# Enter "testuserpickerfield" as the default value and select "Set Default"
# Delete the user "testuserpickerfield"
# Attempt to create any type of issue, in any project.
# Observe the error message when you select the "create" button.
fields.summary: Custom user picker field isn't part of Screen Scheme, nor specified in workflow, yet still generates error when creating an issue.

As SHA-1 is gradually being phased out, the above documentation should be updated to reflect this or at least inform the users about this

Reference

In JIRA 5, the JIRA logo is located above the menu (Dashboards, Projects, etc)
!1.png|thumbnail!

In JIRA 6, the JIRA logo is located in the same height
!2.png|thumbnail!

It would be nice to give users options for the location of this logo as some users might prefer it to be above while others might prefer it to be in the same line.

Also, it would be great if users have the option to disable this logo entirely as well.
